Article Title: Debut debacle: It‚Äôs raining startup IPOs but stock prices are in slump
Article Text:
.

MUMBAI: Even as startups are increasingly rushing to Dalal Street, buoyed by a booming primary market, many of the large, listed companies are trading below their IPO offer price, raising concerns over the long-term value they can generate for investors.Stock prices of close to 10 startups including Swiggy, FirstCry, Paytm, Ola Electric and Delhivery are trading below their offer price, data sourced from the exchanges and Prime Database showed (see graphic) . While market volatility and a broader correction have somewhat had a bearing, a bigger overhang has been the tepid growth of the companies which failed to keep pace with the expectations of the street, said analysts tracking the space.‚ÄúThe realisation (on part of investors) that performance is not meeting expectations is resulting in disappointment and value correction,‚Äù said Nikunj Doshi, of Bay Capital. For many startups, acquisitions have been the way of reporting topline growth but whether they are getting reflected in the bottom line remains to be seen, said Doshi.Since 2021, over 30 startups have debuted on the exchanges, ditching larger private fundraises as regulatory easing and higher valuations in public markets made it smoother for firms to go for an IPO.Following a clutch of billiondollar startup listings floated by players such as Lenskart, Groww and Meesho last year, PhonePe, Zepto, Oyo and Flipkart, among others are gearing up for a debut in 2026.To be fair, most of the recently listed startups are trading above their offer price, but analysts said that the performance of digital companies should be weighed after six months of listing. ‚ÄúThese companies are largely funded by VC, PE/HNI investors whose lock in expires after six months of listing and the floodgates of supply open. Some startups saw correction in their prices after six months,‚Äù said Doshi. A lock-in expiry is the time when restrictions on selling share ends, allowing shareholders to sell their stakes, increasing supply in secondary market which can be difficult to absorb.Public market valuations for tech-led businesses have meaningfully reset from the peak cycle. For instance, in the case of high-quality SaaS companies, which were earlier trading at mid-teens revenue multiples, current market benchmarks are materially lower, reflecting both multiple compression and a moderation in growth rate versus earlier expectations, said Mehekka Oberoi, fund manager at IIFL Fintech Fund. The next batch of startups may have to list at lower valuations compared to their last private fundings.
Article Summary: Stock prices of close to 10 startups including swiggy, firstcry, paytm, ola electric and delhivery are trading below their offer price. Since 2021, over 30 startups have debuted on the exchanges. The next batch of startups may have to list at lower valuations compared to their last private fundings.

Article Title: MLB trade rumors: Philadelphia Phillies could bag $6.7 million Minnesota Twins veteran catcher to replace JT Realmuto
Article Text:
Philadelphia Phillies' Nick Castellanos, left, celebrates with Brandon Marsh, right, and other teammates (Image via AP Photo/Chris Szagola)

Philadelphia Phillies planning ahead at catcher

Ryan Jeffers of Minnesota Twins (Image via Getty)

Why Ryan Jeffers stands out

What a trade could look like

2025 performance snapshot

My Two Cents On This Mock Trade

The Philadelphia Phillies are preparing for the possibility that J.T. Realmuto will not return for 2026. Contract talks have not moved, and pitchers and catchers are close to reporting. With no clear answer yet, the team is looking at alternatives.One name that keeps coming up is Ryan Jeffers of the Minnesota Twins. The Phillies see him as a realistic option if Realmuto leaves in free agency. His age, contract status, and recent production make him a practical target rather than a splash move.JT Realmuto is 35 and coming off a quieter season at the plate. Even so, his track record means other teams are interested, and his next contract is expected to be expensive. That has pushed the Philadelphia Phillies to explore the trade market rather than wait and react late.Jeffers fits what the Phillies are looking for. He is younger, costs far less, and is under team control for 2026 through arbitration. At $6.7 million, he would give the team stability behind the plate without locking them into a long-term deal.Ryan Jeffers brings power that plays well at catcher and steady defense.In 2025, he produced a strong OPS and handled his defensive duties cleanly. While he does not match Realmuto‚Äôs arm or speed, he offers reliable all-around play and is entering his prime years.For the Phillies, he would be a bridge option. They stay competitive now while keeping future flexibility.A possible deal would send outfielder Justin Crawford and pitcher Gage Wood to Minnesota. Crawford is one of the Philadelphia Phillies‚Äô top prospects, and Wood adds pitching depth. The Twins are looking to restock with young talent after recent roster changes, and this type of return fits that goal.The deal would not require Philadelphia to move a big-league contract, keeping the payroll clean.Also read: MLB trade rumors: Chicago Cubs predicted to pursue $33 million Toronto Blue Jays star infielder post blockbuster Edward Cabrera deal Philadelphia would get a younger, cheaper catcher who can start right away. Minnesota would turn a player nearing free agency into long-term pieces. If Realmuto moves on, Jeffers is a sensible next step rather than a risky gamble.
Article Summary: The philadelphia phillies are preparing for the possibility that j.t. Realmuto will not return for 2026. Contract talks have not moved, and pitchers and catchers are close to reporting. Ryan jeffers of the minnesota twins is a realistic option if realmuto leaves in free agency.

Article Title: Sidney Crosby‚Äôs net worth: Details on Penguins captain‚Äôs contracts, earnings, endorsements and luxury collection
Article Text:
Sidney Crosby of the Pittsburgh Penguins (Credit: Getty Images)

Sidney Crosby Net Worth ‚òÖ Biography ‚òÖHouse ‚òÖ Cars ‚òÖ Income ‚òÖ Pet ‚òÖ Family - 2017

Sidney Crosby of Pittsburgh Penguins' luxury collection, assets and net worth explained



Sidney Crosby has impacted professional ice hockey for more than 20 years. Being the captain of the Pittsburgh Penguins, he has not only brought his team to several Stanley Cup championships but also made himself a highly marketable star in the sport. His skills at the rink have led to financial popularity in the real world.Crosby has had a successful career with a steady performance, leadership, and brand popularity that has seen him attract very lucrative deals with the NHL as well as endorsements. His financial portfolio is made up of multi-million dollar transactions with international organizations as well as strategic investments, which demonstrates his athleticism and business expertise. The question that fans would ask themselves is what the actual scope of his net worth would be, and how he spends his money, having made it.By early 2026, the net worth of Sidney Crosby is estimated to be 75 million dollars. Much of this money is a result of his long-term NHL contracts. During his 20 years of service with the Pittsburgh Penguins, Crosby has been able to make over $155 million in salary alone. The last contract he signed is a two-year renewal extension worth $17.4 million, signed in September 2024, which keeps him a prominent member of the league until the 2026-27 season.Crosby has also used his popularity to endorse some of the major brands such as Adidas, Gatorade, Tim Hortons, and CCM. These transactions make him very rich in terms of his net worth and depict his fame across the globe. In addition to endorsements, Crosby has been investing in different types of businesses, and this has established a diversified portfolio that he can rely upon even after he retires from the NHL.In addition to money, Crosby has a luxurious lifestyle. He has high-performance vehicles, oceanfront homes, and a carefully assembled collection of memorabilia. All of that reflects his career success, as these possessions not only display his wealth. But they also give his fans a glimpse into the life of one of the greatest players in the game of hockey. He believes in doing things well on and off the ice, and this makes Crosby a celebrated athlete as well as a successful entrepreneur.Also Read: Brad Marchand‚Äôs lifestyle: Inside Florida Panthers star‚Äôs early life, NHL career, and personal adventures
Article Summary: Sidney crosby has had a successful career with a steady performance, leadership, and brand popularity. Much of this money is a result of his long-term nhl contracts. In addition to endorsements, crosby has been investing in different types of businesses, and this has established a diversified portfolio.

Article Title: Seiya Suzuki and Airi Hatakeyama combined net worth in 2025: Contracts, sponsorships, and long-term finances of Cubs star
Article Text:
Seiya Suzuki and Airi Hatakeyama (Image Source: Getty)

Seiya Suzuki‚Äôs contracts, salaries, and sponsorships in 2025

Airi Hatakeyama's career in media and gymnastics, and the net worth of the duo

The financial power of Seiya Suzuki is largely based on his $85 million, five-year contract with the Cubs, which guarantees him a smooth ride through 2026. His total earnings during his career, worth $67 million, combined with his endorsements in both Japan and the U.S. , make his net worth approximately $70 million. Due to his endorsements, Olympic background, and steady performance in MLB, Suzuki is not only a pillar of the Cubs but also a worldwide sports brand with financial security for a long time to come. Airi Hatakeyama was an internationally recognized rhythmic gymnast from Japan who eventually stopped competing but continued to impress the world as a representative of her nation.Seiya Suzuki's monetary power stands firmly on his six-year, $85 million contract with the Chicago Cubs. His Olympic heritage and MLB recognition have turned him into a favored person for promotional activities, thus augmenting his financial portfolio. By 2025, Suzuki‚Äôs fortune is projected to be between $68 and $70 million, which is a combination of his contract, endorsements, and past winnings in Nippon Professional Baseball.With guaranteed payments until 2026 and huge sponsorships, the Japanese superstar's financial situation has been stabilized, hence making him one of the most successful Japanese players in MLB and a key part of the Cubs' future plans. The combination of Suzuki's contracts, sponsorships, and disciplined financial management places him among the most successful Japanese players in the MLB, and he still has a very bright and steady future ahead of him.It is reported that Airi‚Äôs net worth is approximately $1.8-$2 million, which she made through her sports, media, and brand partnerships. Although it is small compared to Suzuki‚Äôs MLB fortune, Hatakeyama‚Äôs diversified career lets her keep her independence in terms of finances. The total of the couple‚Äôs net worth is around $70-$72 million, making them one of the most financially successful sports couples in Japan.Their finances for the long run are secured by Suzuki's guaranteed MLB contract till 2026, endorsements and sponsorships in Japan and the U.S., and Hatakeyama's steady media career with possible future ventures.Also Read: Chicago Cubs Resolve the DH Conflict with the Japanese Outfielder Seiya Suzuki

How much did Kimi Antonelli earn in a year as an emerging Formula One driver

Glimpse into the net worth of Mercedes‚Äôs new Formula One driver Kimi Antonelli

Being a part of the Mercedes Formula One team and signing deals with various premium brands, Andrea Antonelli has marked the first step of his success in the year 2025.Before joining the senior club of Mercedes AMG Petronas, Andrea Antonelli was already selected for the Mercedes Junior team, which was the start of his Formula One career. In the year 2014, Andrea Antonelli started his career with karting competitions, followed by his selection in several junior racing leagues.As per the sources, Andrea Antonelli is believed to have signed a contract with Mercedes AMG Petronas for a period of one year and will be receiving an annual package of around $2 million.Andrea Antonelli will be receiving a total amount of around $5 million only from his salary and bonus upon signing the contract at the Formula One racing competition.After delivering his special debut in 2025, it is believed that Kimi Antonelli has signed up with premium brands, bringing his total net worth to around $11 million at the end of 2025. Premium luxury brands such as IWC Schaffhausen and Police Lifestyle have officially announced their collaboration with Andrea Antonelli. Other than that, high-end sportswear companies such as Adidas have collaborated with Kimi Antonelli.All of Kimi Antonelli‚Äôs collaborations with premium brands are believed to be paid collaborations, which will significantly increase his annual net worth in the coming year. Andrea Antonelli has been a significant addition to the Mercedes Formula 1 company, replacing Lewis Hamilton, and if he performed deliberately, he would climb the path to a wealthy fortune in the future.Also Read: Ralf Schumacher net worth: Formula 1 salary, winnings and other income

Article Title: Justin Verlander‚Äôs lifestyle: Inside the San Francisco Giants star‚Äôs luxury car collection
Article Text:

Justin Verlander, the pitcher for the San Francisco Giants, is known for his love of cars and has some of the best arms in baseball. Years of major MLB contracts and prizes have left him with a spectacular collection of high-performance luxury cars. Justin Verlander's garage has classic muscle cars and contemporary supercars reflecting his enthusiasm for driving fast machines and his taste. All fans can see his cars in posts he has shared online.One of the most eye-catching cars in Justin Verlander‚Äôs collection is the Lamborghini Aventador Roadster.This car is a bright, open-top supercar with a powerful V12 engine that makes a loud roar when it drives.The Aventador can go from slow to very fast in just a few seconds and has styling that stands out on the road. It is often a head-turner wherever Verlander takes it.Justin Verlander also owns a Ferrari 458 Italia, one of his prized cars. This Ferrari is known for sharp handling and a strong V8 engine that can go fast in a blink.Verlander bought this car after earning big money in his baseball career. It is one of the Italian cars that show his love for European supercars.Another standout in Verlander‚Äôs garage is the Ford GT. This is an American supercar made in limited numbers and built for speed.It has a twin-turbo engine under the hood and shows how Verlander enjoys both Italian and American performance cars.He has shared photos of the GT on social media, and fans know it as one of his favorites.Justin Verlander also loves classic cars, and one of the most fun items he owns is a 1967 Ford Mustang ‚ÄúEleanor.‚ÄùThis car is a replica of the muscle car made famous in the movie Gone in 60 Seconds. It combines old-school design with contemporary custom work to create a unique item for his collection.Verlander has discussed his great pleasure in keeping such a vintage car in addition to his contemporary supercar collection.Justin Verlander's fleet of vehicles reflects his passion of high performance cars and long baseball career.His garage features European supercars to a classic American muscle car, reflecting a mix of style, power, and personal preferences that viewers love to see on and off the course.Also Read: MLB Trade Rumors: Cody Bellinger Draws Chicago Cubs And New York Yankees Interest While Rockies Weigh Brenton Doyle, Mickey Moniak Moves

Article Title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to showcase AI at CES 2026: Here‚Äôs how to watch the live stream
Article Text:
What to expect from Jensen Huang‚Äôs keynote

Nvidia Makes History: First Company to Hit $4 Trillion Market Cap





Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is all set to take the stage at the 3,800‚Äëseat Fontainebleau BleauLive Theater in Las Vegas on Monday, January 5, 2026, at 1 p.m. PT (2.30 AM IST). The keynote will be live-streamed globally, making it accessible to anyone following the event online. ‚ÄúJoin us in Las Vegas as Jensen Huang shares what‚Äôs next in AI in a special presentation. Chat with fellow tech enthusiasts, enjoy food and drinks, and stand a chance to win exclusive NVIDIA Gear Store merchandise. Reserve your seat today,‚Äù said the company.Huang‚Äôs keynote is said to be centred around what‚Äôs new for AI‚Äù, reflecting Nvidia‚Äôs central role in powering massive AI data centers worldwide. While CES 2025 focused heavily on hardware, expectations for CES 2026 are more centered on AI, robotics, simulation, gaming, and content creation, with Nvidia promising 20+ live demos.Although speculation around new RTX Super graphics cards has cooled due to a lack of credible leaks, Nvidia may still surprise attendees with announcements in GPUs, AI platforms, or partnerships. Rising memory costs and industry chatter about Nvidia‚Äôs Grace Blackwell and upcoming Vera Rubin GPU platforms add intrigue to the presentation.
Article Summary: Nvidia ceo jensen huang is all set to take the stage at the 3,800‚Äëseat fontainebleau bleaulive theater in las vegas on january 5, 2026. The keynote will be live-streamed globally, making it accessible to anyone following the event online.

Article Title: When Amazon founder Jeff Bezos agreed that AI is in an 'industrial bubble' with investors who ...
Article Text:
‚ÄòAI is for real‚Äô



Investor concerns beyond Jeff Bezos







Amazon founder Jeff Bezos has once again cautioned that artificial intelligence is presently an ‚Äòindustrial bubble‚Äô, even he insisted that the technology itself is real and will ultimately deliver huge amounts of benefits to the society. Recently, speaking at the Italian Tech Week alongside Exor CEO John Elkann, Bezos said that the excitement around AI has led to unusual investor behaviour, with billions of dollars flowing into companies regardless strong fundamentals.Bezos explained that bubbles are characterised by inflated stock prices and a rush of funding into both good and bad ideas. This makes it difficult for the investor to distinguish.Bezos further outlined the hallmarks of bubbles. He said that the current AI climate as one where ‚Äúevery experiment or idea gets funded,‚Äù even if the fundamentals are weak. He pointed to unusual behavior such as small companies with only a handful of employees receiving billions of dollars in investment. This, he said, is a hallmark of industrial bubbles, where excitement drives capital into ventures indiscriminately.Despite this caution, Bezos feels that the technology itself is genuine and transformative. ‚ÄúAI is real, and it is going to change every industry,‚Äù he told the audience. He further compared the situation to the biotech bubble of the 1990s, which witnessed many companies fail but ultimately produced some life-saving drugs. Industrial bubbles, he argued, are not necessarily harmful; when the dust settles, society benefits from the inventions that survive.Bezos‚Äô remarks echo a growing chorus of warnings from business leaders. Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, has previously said the AI market is in a bubble. At the same event in Turin, Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon cautioned that investor excitement often overlooks risks, predicting a ‚Äúreset‚Äù or ‚Äúdrawdown‚Äù in valuations. Similarly, Karim Moussalem, chief investment officer at Selwood Asset Management, recently said the AI trade is beginning to resemble ‚Äúone of the great speculative manias of market history. ‚Äù
Article Summary: Amazon founder jeff bezos has once again cautioned that artificial intelligence is presently an ‚Äòindustrial bubble‚Äô however, even he insisted that the technology itself is real and will ultimately deliver huge amounts of benefits to the society. He said that the current ai climate as one where ‚Äúevery experiment or idea gets funded,‚Äù even if the fundamentals are weak.

Article Title: Oracle founder Larry Ellison tells the biggest problem with AI models from Google, OpenAI, Meta, and other big tech companies
Article Text:
Oracle's Larry Ellison believes AI's next frontier is private enterprise data, not just public internet. He argues current models are commoditized and true value lies in securely accessing and reasoning over sensitive company information. Oracle is investing heavily, leveraging its vast database presence to become the enterprise AI backbone, facing competition from cloud rivals.

Oracle bets big on becoming the enterprise AI backbone

The race for private data access heats up





Oracle founder and CTO Larry Ellison has identified what he calls the critical limitation holding back AI models from Gemini to ChatGPT: they're all trained on the same publicly available internet data, making them increasingly commoditized with little real differentiation between them.Speaking during Oracle's fiscal Q2 2026 earnings call in December, Ellison argued that while training foundational models on public data has created "the largest and fastest-growing business in human history," the real value lies ahead in a second phase: enabling these models to securely reason over private enterprise data without compromising security."For these models to reach their peak value, you need to train them not just on publicly available data, but make privately owned data available for those models as well," Ellison said. He estimates this next phase will prove "even larger and more valuable" than the current GPU and data center boom.Oracle is positioning itself as uniquely equipped for this shift. The company points out that most of the world's high-value private data already lives in Oracle databases. Its AI Data Platform uses techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation to let any major AI model query private data in real-time while maintaining security.The company is backing this vision with aggressive spending, projecting roughly $50 billion in capital expenditures for the full year, up from $35 billion estimated in September. At Oracle AI World in October, the company announced partnerships including a 50,000-GPU AI supercluster with AMD MI450 chips launching in Q3 2026, and the OCI Zettascale10 supercomputer connecting hundreds of thousands of NVIDIA GPUs.Ellison's thesis faces challenges from multiple angles. Synthetic data generation could reduce dependence on exclusive proprietary data sets; real-time user interaction data from consumer apps could turn out to be more valuable than static enterprise records. At the same time, rivals like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud are racing to develop comparable enterprise AI capabilities, though Oracle argues its established grip on enterprise databases gives it a strategic advantage. By late 2025, the company's cloud backlog had topped $500 billion, driven mostly by demand for AI.
Article Summary: Oracle's larry ellison believes ai's next frontier is private enterprise data. He argues current models are commoditized and true value lies in securely accessing and reasoning over sensitive company information. Oracle is investing heavily, leveraging its vast database presence to become the enterprise ai backbone.

Article Title: Nvidia unveils Alpamayo, an AI model for autonomous vehicles; Elon Musk says ‚ÄòWhat they will find is ‚Ä¶‚Äô
Article Text:
Nvidia CEO on Alpamayo: ChatGPT moment of physical AI is here

Nvidia‚Äôs Alpamayo to debut with Mercedes CLA





At the ongoing Consumer Electronics Show (CES), Nvidia launched Alpamayo ‚Äì an open source AI model for autonomous vehicles. Announcing the new AI model, CEO Jensen Huang said that it is the world‚Äôs first thinking, reasoning autonomous vehicle AI. He further revealed that the Alpamayo is launching on US roads later this year, starting with the Mercedes CLA. ‚ÄúAlpamayo brings reasoning to autonomous vehicles, allowing them to think through rare scenarios, drive safely in complex environments, and explain their driving decisions,‚Äù he further added. Responding to one such posts about the autonomous vehicle AI, Tesla CEO Elon Musk wrote:‚ÄúWell that‚Äôs just exactly what Tesla is doing üòÇ What they will find is that it‚Äôs easy to get to 99% and then super hard to solve the long tail of the distribution.‚ÄùAlpamayo introduces Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models designed for self-driving systems. The models will allow autonomous vehicles to understand visual inputs, assess driving situations and decide on driving actions. The platform also includes large reasoning models, simulation tools to test rare or unusual driving situations, and open datasets that can be used for training and validation.Talking about Alpamayo, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said in a statement that ‚ÄúThe ChatGPT moment for physical AI is here ‚Äì when machines begin to understand, reason, and act in the real world‚Äù.‚ÄúIt's trained end-to-end. Literally from camera in to actuation out; It reasons what action it is about to take, the reason by which it came about that action, and the trajectory‚Äù, he added."With a 10-billion-parameter architecture, Alpamayo 1 uses video input to generate trajectories alongside reasoning traces, showing the logic behind each decision. Developers can adapt Alpamayo 1 into smaller runtime models for vehicle development, or use it as a foundation for AV development tools such as reasoning-based evaluators and auto-labeling systems. Alpamayo 1 provides open model weights and open-source inferencing scripts. Future models in the family will feature larger parameter counts, more detailed reasoning capabilities, more input and output flexibility, and options for commercial usage," he continued.As mentioned above, Nvidia has partnered with Mercedes to bring its autonomous vehicle AI. Announcing the partnership, the chip maker said ‚ÄúNVIDIA is enabling a new era of AI-defined driving, bringing its NVIDIA DRIVE AV software with enhanced level 2 point-to-point driver assistance capabilities to U.S. roads, expected by end of this year ‚Äî starting with Mercedes-Benz, a long-standing partner in advancing safe, intelligent mobility. ‚Äù‚ÄúThe all-new Mercedes-Benz CLA ‚Äî the brand‚Äôs first vehicle featuring the MB.OS platform ‚Äî introduces advanced driver-assistance features powered by NVIDIA‚Äôs full-stack DRIVE AV software, AI infrastructure and accelerated compute.This design may enable over-the-air updates of future upgrades and new features, including planned enhancements to MB.DRIVE ASSIST PRO, which may be available ex-factory and through the Mercedes-Benz store.‚Äù
Article Summary: Nvidia‚Äôs alpamayo to debut with mercedes cla later this year. The chip maker has partnered with mercedes to bring its autonomous vehicle ai. Nvidia ceo jensen huang: ‚Äúthe chatgpt moment for physical ai is here ‚Äì when machines begin to understand, reason, and act in the real world‚Äù

Article Title: When Mark Zuckerberg shared his basic hiring rule at Meta to tell college students: The most important decision you make in college is ...
Article Text:
FILE - Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg. (AP Photo/Nic Coury, File)

EXPOSED: Mark Zuckerberg Embarrassed on Hot Mic Admitting Total Confusion During Trump Dinner





Ever since Mark Zuckerberg announced the creation of Meta Superintelligence Labs in first half of 2025, Meta CEO has been on an AI hiring blitz. A Twitter user who goes by the moniker @HinataMotivates, said to be a tech-motivation account, shared a podcast clip (going back to 2022) where Zuckerberg talks about Meta hiring rule and his advice for college students. Mark Zuckerberg has a hiring rule that he says is cardinal for him while hiring anyone and the one that he says is also an important tip for any college student. In an episode of the ‚ÄúLex Fridman Podcast,‚Äù hosted by MIT computer scientist Lex Fridman, Zuckerberg said that most people know Facebook ‚Äôs dorm-room origin story and that many have learned the wrong lesson from it. He said that his initial ability to launch Facebook wasn‚Äôt because he dropped out of college. According to Zuckerberg, it was due to the personal connections he made while he was still in school.Who you spend time with in college, Zuckerberg said, is ‚Äúthe most important decision‚Äù any student can make in college. He advised college students that choosing their social circle is the most pivotal decision, as people tend to emulate those around them. ‚ÄúYou become the people you surround yourself with,‚Äù he said in the podcast.‚ÄúI think probably people are too, in general, objective focused, and maybe not focused enough on the connections and the people who they‚Äôre basically building relationships [with]. ‚Äù Meta CEO Zuckerberg is said to have met his Facebook co-founders ‚Å†‚Äî Eduardo Saverin, Dustin Moskovitz, Chris Hughes and Andrew McCollum ‚Å†‚Äî while the five were students at Harvard University.While the group split up in a not-so-happy manner, Zuckerberg said on the podcast that he tries to prioritize relationships over objectives. This applies especially to hiring. Zuckerberg said that he extends the idea to his Meta hiring philosophy: He only employs candidates he did hypothetically work for, underscoring reciprocity and alignment in professional networks. When evaluating a job candidate, he imagines what it would be like to work for that person. ‚ÄúI will only hire someone to work for me if I can see myself working for them,‚Äù he said.Mark Zuckerberg said that the strategy creates a work environment that‚Äôs both more cohesive and more productive: If you work with people who share your values on a human level, you‚Äôll be more likely to smoothly achieve your work goals together. It‚Äôs all about finding personal compatibility, he said, not unlike ‚Äúchoosing friends or a partner.‚Äù
Article Summary: Mark zuckerberg has a hiring rule that he says is cardinal for him while hiring anyone. He said that his initial ability to launch facebook wasn‚Äôt because he dropped out of college. According to zuckerberg, it was due to the personal connections he made while he was still in school.

Article Title: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu: This is how we learn in Zoho, we let‚Ä¶
Article Text:
Zoho Chief Scientist Sridhar Vembu revealed an engineer built a complex security tool in a month using AI, a task usually taking a year. Another senior engineer now completes three-week projects in a day. Zoho is rolling out AI coding tools company-wide with strict engineer oversight, empowering even junior staff to create impactful internal solutions.

Zoho senior engineer ships three-week projects in one day





Zoho founder and Chief Scientist Sridhar Vembu has revealed that one of his engineers recently built a sophisticated assembly and machine code security tool alone in just one month‚Äîwork that would typically require a team of three to four developers an entire year. The breakthrough, Vembu disclosed on X, came after the engineer discovered Anthropic's Claude Opus 4.5 model, which he called a "game changer" that finally convinced him AI-generated code was worth using."I did not know he was building it. I was blown away by the depth and breadth of the tool," Vembu wrote, describing how the experienced developer from his R&D team created the project in his spare time. The Zoho founder characterized the moment as the arrival of "powerful machine looms for software development," comparing the disruption to how mechanized weaving once challenged traditional handloom workers.The productivity gains extend across Zoho's engineering organization. Vembu shared that one of the company's most productive engineers‚Äîa veteran with two decades of experience handling performance-critical UI work‚Äîis now completing in a single day what previously took three weeks. "AI needed him to provide the structure, it fleshed out the details and that required him to draw on his experience," Vembu explained.The Indian SaaS giant has rolled out AI coding tools company-wide but with strict guardrails. Engineers must review and approve all AI-generated code and take full responsibility for it, Vembu emphasized. Zoho doesn't mandate AI usage, instead leaving implementation decisions to experienced developers who can assess when the technology adds value.Even junior developers are seeing breakthroughs. Vembu noted that a less experienced team member built an internal tool with AI assistance that's now being used across multiple teams‚Äîwork that wouldn't have been possible without the technology. For UI development specifically, Vembu's team is "very bullish on AI.""As Chief Scientist, I am under pressure," Vembu admitted, acknowledging the technology's transformative impact. "Wish us luck."
Article Summary: Zoho chief scientist sridhar vembu revealed an engineer built a complex security tool in a month using ai. Another senior engineer now completes three-week projects in a day. Zoho is rolling out ai coding tools company-wide with strict engineer oversight.

Article Title: Nvidia announces Vera Rubin AI chip, claims it is 5X more powerful than Blackwell
Article Text:
What is the Vera Rubin AI platform

Nvidia Makes History: First Company to Hit $4 Trillion Market Cap

Lower cost and faster AI processing

Elon Musk on Nvidia‚Äôs Rubin AI chip





Nvidia has unveiled its next-generation AI computing platform, called Vera Rubin, at the ongoing Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2026 in Las Vegas. The announcement was made by Nvidia founder and CEO Jensen Huang, who said the new platform is now in full production. Rubin is designed to support large-scale artificial intelligence workloads and is aimed at data centres, cloud providers and enterprises building advanced AI systems. Nvidia said the platform is built to lower the cost of AI computing and support faster training and deployment of AI models. Rubin succeeds Nvidia‚Äôs Blackwell architecture and is part of the company‚Äôs broader push to expand AI use across industries.Vera Rubin is Nvidia‚Äôs first six-chip AI platform developed using an ‚Äúextreme codesign‚Äù approach, where multiple components are designed together. The platform includes Rubin GPUs, Vera CPUs, NVLink 6 networking, Spectrum-X Ethernet Photonics, ConnectX-9 networking cards and BlueField-4 data processing units. Nvidia said this design helps reduce bottlenecks and improve performance for large AI workloads.The Rubin GPU delivers up to 50 petaflops of inference performance using NVFP4 precision. The Vera CPU is designed to handle data movement and AI agent processing tasks. Nvidia said the platform is built to support large-scale AI training and inference more efficiently.According to Nvidia, the Rubin platform can reduce the cost of generating AI tokens to about one-tenth of previous platforms. The company also introduced an AI-focused storage system called Inference Context Memory Storage, which is designed to improve long-context AI processing by increasing speed and efficiency.Nvidia said the Rubin platform will be used alongside its open AI models and software tools to support applications in areas such as autonomous driving, robotics, healthcare and climate research.The announcement was shared by an X user Sawyer Merritt who also shared a video of the chip maker‚Äôs next-generation Rubin chips. Responding to the post, Musk said ‚ÄúIt will take another 9 months or so before the hardware is operational at scale and the software works well‚Äù, highlighting deployment realities beyond raw power claims.
Article Summary: Vera rubin is nvidia‚Äôs first six-chip ai platform developed using an ‚Äòextreme codesign‚Äô approach, where multiple components are designed together. The rubin platform can reduce the cost of generating ai tokens to about one-tenth of previous platforms.

Article Title: Vivek Ramaswamy‚Äôs old take on caste surfaces on Twitter after he quits social media
Article Text:
Usha Vance J**t Slur Sparks Firestorm: Vivek Ramaswamy‚Äôs Outburst Splits MAGA | ‚ÄòYou Have No Place‚Ä¶‚Äô

How social media takes things out of context

America's evolving caste debate





Current Ohio gubernatorial candidate and former Republican presidential candidate, Vivek Ramaswamy recently went into a social media exile, announcing his decision to quit his personal social media accounts on X (Formerly Twitter) and Instagram. Citing the reasons that modern social media is becoming "increasingly disconnected from the electorate" and the messages being "negative and bombastic," he shared the decision in an op-ed published in The Wall Street Journal on Monday.At the same time, an excerpt from his 2021 book 'Woke, Inc.: Inside Corporate America's Social Justice Scam' has resurfaced on Twitter and has been circulating all over the social media app. A post on the app, shared a photo of the excerpt written back in the day, highlighting Ramaswamy's description of Indian caste society and his experience with it. What followed was a familiar social media cycle: selective emphasis, rising outrage, and a narrative that quickly hardened into accusation."Did you know that @VivekGRamaswamy was born into the highest caste of Indian, so special even royalty is below him? That his childhood servants can't walk through the same doors as him? That he wears a magic rope "Poonal" so he can be special even when naked?," called out the post, inciting numerous X users into criticising the politician.The post, which has received 94.3K views on the social media app, had parts of the excerpt strategically underlined to create a narrative where Ramaswamy boasted of himself being Brahmin, the highest caste in the Hindu society and that the people who provided service to his family were of the lower caste and entered the house through different gates. That every person who was a part of the society understood its values and principles. It portrays Ramaswamy as an extremely proud casteist, thus leading to comments such as: "talking about discrimination with zero knowledge" and " Vivek is quite literally the worst type of human."The book which the excerpt belongs to was published back in 2021 and was Ramaswamy's debut as an author. What the post described as a casteist lens is actually an attempt to explain a larger subject through a more comprehensible and personal anecdote.'Woke, Inc.' is a book about American corporate identity politics and caste is used as an illustrative example, not the subject. In the writing, Ramaswamy clearly explains how hierarchy does not always align with wealth or power across societies.He gives the example of an Indian society, mentioning the four castes, Brahmins the priests, Kshatriyas the kings, Vaishyas the commercial class and Shudras the service caste.He added that caste was a description of social and occupational hierarchy. Brahmins were obligated to pursue knowledge, which didn't come with money or political power. Thus, his grandfather worked as a farm manager, his father as an engineer and his uncle as a doctor. Social customs required the caste to wear a sacred string, Poonal, which was a cultural marker of caste, not a symbol of power.He shared the anecdote of his domestic help who lived with them like relatives and was respected just like family members, unbeknownst as a child that they belonged to a said lower caste. The distinction, he argues, was social rather than economic, a legacy of inherited norms rather than personal animus.It was these social values that led to the formation of rules. They were unfair, but for the people at the time they were associated with a 'proper understanding of the world'.Higher social rank did not mean an escape from the economic troubles for anyone who was a part of the society. The excerpt was a description, not the norm. But reading only the underlined parts of it could have anyone carrying a brick and walking towards the political leader.Numerous times social media screenshots are taken out of context, especially when they are targeted at non-Indian audiences who lack the social context. Explanations are reduced to screenshots, writings to advocacy and context disappears.Caste has become politicised in parts of the US, especially California. Back in 2023, Senate Bill 403 or SB403 was passed by the state legislature to explicitly ban caste discrimination. Although the bill was vetoed by Governor Gavin Newsom, it reflected growing concern about caste dynamics within South Asian immigrant communities, by adding caste as a protected class to the state's existing anti-discrimination laws.The same year Seattle became the first US city to outlaw caste discrimination with followed by Fresno. As per activists, the issue is more prominent in Americans of Indian descent and Hindus. Since most of them move to Silicon Valley and California, these places confront the issue of caste discrimination.But is it true? A 2018 report from Equality Labs, a California-based non-profit, stated that 25% of Dalit respondents said they had faced verbal or physical assault based on their caste; 50% of Dalits live in fear of their caste being outed; 67% reported being treated unfairly at their workplace.However, the survey was web-based, self-reported, and conducted among respondents already engaged with anti-caste advocacy.By contrast, a report by the Carnegie Foundation and YouGov, found only 1% of Hindu Indian Americans who identified themselves with a caste were Dalit. 80% of Hindus in America who identified with a caste, are upper caste. Of those Indian Americans who are Hindu, 50% have almost no friends from the same caste as themselves. Thus, caste is not how they self-segregate or identify each other.It is acts like these which substantiate Ramaswamy's quitting of social media. Circulating an old excerpt without proper clarification attempts to feed into the "caste war" narratives and makes social media a negative and bombastic place, as he described.This is not about the current situation of India or about Ramaswamy's current views and opinions. It is about how context can be distorted to manufacture conflict‚Äîparticularly between cultures‚Äîthrough selective framing.
Article Summary: Ohio gubernatorial candidate and former republican presidential candidate, vivek ramaswamy recently went into a social media exile. He announced his decision to quit his personal social media accounts on x (formerly twitter) and instagram.

Article Title: What is SteveWillDoIt‚Äôs net worth? Inside his income from YouTube, NELK Boys, and big brands
Article Text:
What is SteveWillDoIt‚Äôs net worth? Inside his income from YouTube, NELK Boys, and big brands (Image via Getty)

I made a Mr. Beast diss track!! (feat. 6ix9ine)

How SteveWillDoIt built his wealth through NELK, Happy Dad , and his return to YouTube





SteveWillDoIt is rich today because of viral videos, smart business moves, and big brand deals. His net worth is around $5 million, according to CelebrityNetWorth.com. He became famous for wild challenge videos, big giveaways, and risky stunts that many people talked about online. Even when problems slowed him down, his money kept growing.The biggest reason behind SteveWillDoIt‚Äôs wealth is his early rise on social media and his close work with the NELK Boys. That group gave him a massive audience fast. From there, he earned money through merchandise, brand partnerships, and later through a popular drink brand. Even after his YouTube channel was removed in 2022, his income did not stop. Business deals kept him afloat.Now, after returning to YouTube in late 2025, SteveWillDoIt is once again in the spotlight. His online fights, music videos, and podcast talk have pushed his name back into trending news. Love him or not, his journey shows how internet fame can turn into real money.SteveWillDoIt first made money by selling custom clothing between 2016 and 2017. Soon after, he focused on YouTube full time. His channel grew fast and crossed four million subscribers before YouTube removed it in August 2022.Reports at the time said the ban was linked to gambling promotion.Still, his biggest money win came outside YouTube. In 2021, Steve became a co-owner and founding partner of Happy Dad, a hard seltzer brand started with members of NELK. The drink sold widely in the United States and became a strong income source. This helped him stay rich even without his channel.Steve earns additional income from NELK merchandise and through Full Send branded merchandise sales, as well as from various brand partnerships associated with the NELK business. Merchandise and Brand Partnerships produce continuing revenue streams and are currently strong selling items.On November 30, 2025, SteveWillDoIt appeared as a guest on the Impaulsive podcast hosted by Logan Paul and Mike Majlak. During the show, Steve said Jimmy Donaldson, known as MrBeast, ignored him when he asked for help getting his channel back. Steve said, ‚ÄúI felt left out when I needed support the most.‚ÄùAfter YouTube restored his channel in December 2025, Steve released a music video titled ‚ÄúI Made a MrBeast Diss Track‚Äù on January 8, 2026, featuring rapper 6ix9ine. One clean lyric from the song said, ‚ÄúEverything about you feels unreal, and I can see right through it.‚ÄùAs of now, SteveWillDoIt‚Äôs YouTube channel has over one million subscribers, and the video has passed 1.2 million views. His comeback shows that controversy, when paired with business sense, can still bring money.Also Read: MrBeast Net Worth In 2025: YouTube Earnings, Endorsements, Business Empire, Investments And More
Article Summary: Stevewilldoit's net worth is around $5 million, according to celebritynetworth.com. He became famous for wild challenge videos, big giveaways, and risky stunts. He earned money through merchandise, brand partnerships, and later through a popular drink brand.

Article Title: Top 10 richest men in the world 2026: Elon Musk leads with over $700 billion fortune ahead of Larry Page, Jeff Bezos, and Mark Zuckerberg
Article Text:
Top 10 richest men in the world 2026

Elon Musk Can ‚ÄòCRY‚Äô, But He Will Still Pay $140,000,000 X Fine: EU Adamant After Hitler Attack

Rank Name Net Worth 2026 (Approx) 1 Elon Musk $717.9 B 2 Larry Page $258.3 B 3 Larry Ellison $245.3 B 4 Jeff Bezos $238.6 B 5 Sergey Brin $238.4 B 6 Mark Zuckerberg $223 B 7 Bernard Arnault & Family $192.4 B 8 Jensen Huang $163.9 B 9 Warren Buffett $146.8 B 10 Amancio Ortega $145 B

World‚Äôs richest men

Elon Musk ‚Äì $717.9 Billion

Larry Page ‚Äì $258.3 Billion

Larry Ellison ‚Äì $245.3 Billion

Jeff Bezos ‚Äì $238.6 Billion

Sergey Brin ‚Äì $238.4 Billion

Mark Zuckerberg ‚Äì $223 Billion

Bernard Arnault and Family ‚Äì $192.4 Billion

Jensen Huang ‚Äì $163.9 Billion

Warren Buffett ‚Äì $146.8 Billion

Amancio Ortega- $145 Billion





Opening in the year 2026, the world is confronted with economic instability, record inflation levels, and a cost-of-living crisis. But for the elite few, it all just seems much less important to their bank accounts. Today, the combined fortune of the world's 14 richest men tops over $3 trillion across technology, luxury, fashion, AI, and investments. Elon Musk stays ahead in this league for the fifth consecutive year, with a mind-numbing $717.9 billion fortune that has almost doubled within the past couple of years. In contrast, newcomers join this league as a result of AI and semiconductor storms and planned investments. The symbolic wealth levels of these influential few stand in contrast to the increasing difference between the problems within the world and the super-rich.As of 2026, the world‚Äôs wealthiest men continue to amass staggering fortunes despite global economic challenges. According to Forbes, the top 10 richest men, led by Elon Musk, now hold combined wealth exceeding $3 trillion, dominating sectors from technology and AI to luxury, fashion, and global investments, reshaping markets, influencing policy, driving innovation, and redefining modern economic power.Elon Musk, Tesla, SpaceX, and X‚Äôs CEO, sustains his dominance in the list of global billionaires.The value of Musk's net worth escalated from 2021‚Äôs $300 billion to 2026's $717.9 billion because of the phenomenal performance of electric cars, space exploration, and social media reach. Musk's entry and eventual support or endorsement of Donald Trump in politics made news but made no tangible contribution to or subtraction from his net worth. Tesla is leading in global electric cars, while SpaceX is working towards making rocket technology reusable. Musk's projects also cover energy storage, AI, and neural tech, providing him with multiple income streams. Musk's increases in net worth despite controversies, disagreements with authorities, or unpleasant encounters with influential persons in social media like Twitter make him the richest person in planet Earth.Co-founder of Google, Larry Page, has leaped to the second position in the worldwide list. There has been a remarkable increase in his wealth from 133.1 billion to 258.3 billion dollars in one year alone. Though Larry has kept himself away from the limelight, he has been pursuing long-term ventures such as the ‚Äúmoonshot‚Äù projects of Alphabet, which comprises self-driving automobiles and AI-based health care. Though he is no longer actively involved with Google, his impact on the company‚Äôs planning has ensured an increase in his wealth. He is the epitome of success for innovators who firmly believe that innovations related to the tech infrastructure of data enterprises will result in massive returns.Oracle founder Larry Ellison, who holds 98% ownership of LƒÅna‚Äòi in Hawaii, has moved up to the third position for 2026. This follows his net worth rising from $199.5 billion. He has also served as a technology advisor for Artificial Intelligence policy and strategy with expertise gleaned from his years at Oracle. He has diversified his portfolio, including involvement with ‚Äòreal estate, sailing, and life sciences. Ellison has demonstrated his capacity to engage with entrepreneurship and diversify his reach globally, keeping him relevant as one of the most significant stakeholders among the wealthy across the world.Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, has slipped to the fourth position, down from $248.1 billion last year. Bezos is a visibly successful person due to his dominance in online e-commerce, cloud computing through AWS, and media ventures like Prime Video. Bezos has had enormous success due to decades of expansion, acquisitions, and reach, but he still invests in space technology through Blue Origin, along with philanthropic work in climate change and healthcare.Sergey Brin, Google co-founder, is at number five with a net worth of $238.4 billion. The position is an improvement from last year, when he ranked fifth with a net worth of $155.4 billion. Sergey Brin's net worth has been strengthened by Alphabet‚Äôs success in AI, cloud computing technology, and autonomous driving technology. Sergey Brin is still engaged in innovation and is a major beneficiary of Alphabet's long-term initiatives.Facebook‚Äôs founder, Mark Zuckerberg, has also minutely slid out from the top five richest people, with a wealth ranking of $223 billion from the previous year‚Äôs assessment of $219.9 billion. Mark Zuckerberg keeps pushing the initiatives for the ‚Äúmetaverse,‚Äù AI, and social networking. Zuckerberg‚Äôs presence in shaping technology policies and trends around the world has not changed, even though there are certain fluctuations.France's luxury leader, Bernard Arnault, has fallen to the sixth spot from the first position in 2024, but the value of his net worth, which is sourced from the success of LVMH as well as brands such as Louis Vuitton, Dior, and Sephora, is still a remarkable $192.4 billion, slightly lower from the previous year's $195.1 billion, thus symbolizing the timeless use value of exclusive luxury products.A Taiwanese national, Nvidia's co-founder, Jensen Huang, has experienced tremendous growth because of the AI and silicon revolution. His net worth increased from 128.4 billion to 163.9 billion dollars. Huang's vision to develop chips for the gaming, AI, and data center markets has made him one of the leading tech billionaires globally.The 95-year-old investment guru and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway has an estimated net worth of $146.8 billion, a marginal improvement from $143.4 billion. The key to Mr. Buffett‚Äôs achievement is his long period of value investing and his knack for investing in businesses during favorable times and diversifying his investment portfolios across various sectors.Amancio Ortega, the Spanish fashion tycoon behind Zara, is still a giant in the industry with an estimated wealth of 145 billion dollars. His success in the fast-fashion industry has been fueled by expansion and supply chain management. Amancio Ortega proves that the success in the affordable fashion industry translates to the accumulation of unimaginable wealth.
Article Summary: Elon musk, tesla, spacex, and x‚Äôs ceo, sustains his dominance in the list of global billionaires. Co-founder of google, larry page, has leaped to the second position in the worldwide list. Oracle founder larry ellison, who holds 98% ownership of lƒÅna‚Äôi in hawaii, has moved up to the third position for 2026.

Article Title: Clavicular accuses Candace Owens‚Äô manager of demanding $30K a month to ‚ÄúPR train‚Äù him
Article Text:
Clavicular claimed he was approached after appearing on Fresh and Fit by someone identifying himself as Candace Owens‚Äô manager, who allegedly pushed him to pay $30,000 a month for PR training. Clavicular said the pitch made no sense because his rise came from being openly anti-PR. The allegation has fueled backlash over image control and influencer authenticity.

Candace Owens Targets Macrons Again: 'Brigitte Puts On A Fake Wig, Lipstick And Declares War On...'

Clavicular calls out alleged PR pitch from Candace Owens ‚Äô manager after podcast appearance





A viral video that is spreading across social media has sparked a heated argument on authenticity, influence and the business of public image. In a digital age where unedited personas tend to establish the largest following, the concept of refining the voice of someone can be a misstep with the establishment of creators in the first place.That tension came into focus after online personality Clavicular shared an unexpected behind-the-scenes encounter. His account quickly gained traction, not because of spectacle, but because it tapped into a growing frustration among creators who believe raw honesty matters more than curated talking points.Clavicular revealed that the encounter happened after an appearance on the Fresh and Fit podcast, where he says he was approached privately by someone claiming to represent Candace Owens. According to Clavicular, the pitch was blunt and expensive, and it completely missed the point of why his audience follows him.Here is his full statement, shared without alteration: ‚ÄúAll right, so anyway, I went on Fresh and Fit and there was some guy there lurking in the shadows. He's like, comes up to me, he's like, yo, I'm Candace Owens' manager. He's like, you need PR. And I'm like, wait, what? You want me to have a PR trainer? A handler, essentially, is what they're trying to get me to do.And I'm like, I literally blew up for doing the most anti-PR shit. Like, why would he think that's a good idea? Bro, 100%. And he charged me 30K a month.‚ÄùThe comment struck a nerve because it reflects a wider shift in media power. Independent creators are no longer chasing approval from traditional gatekeepers. Many see PR training as a filter that dulls their edge and distances them from their audience.The alleged $30,000 monthly fee only intensified the backlash. For critics, it symbolized an industry that monetizes control rather than creativity. Supporters of PR argue it protects careers. Detractors see it as reputation management disguised as guidance.Clavicular‚Äôs story has now become part of a larger conversation about who really benefits from media polish. In a space built on direct connection, the demand for handlers may be losing its grip.Also Read: Clavicular rejects MrBeast‚Äôs 10% offer, refuses to ‚Äúgo PR‚Äù and fake his personality for fame
Article Summary: Clavicular claims he was approached after appearing on fresh and fit by someone identifying himself as candace owens‚Äô manager. Clavicular said the pitch made no sense because his rise came from being openly anti-pr. The allegation has fueled backlash over image control and influencer authenticity.

Article Title: What really happened between IShowSpeed and Miss Universe Zimbabwe 2025? Club livestream clip raises questions about respect and planning
Article Text:
What really happened between IShowSpeed and Miss Universe Zimbabwe 2025? Club livestream clip raises questions about respect and planning (Image via Getty)

Darren ‚ÄúIShowSpeed‚Äù and Lyshanda Moyas moment during Zimbabwe livestream sparks debate





Darren ‚ÄúIShowSpeed‚Äù found himself in the middle of an online debate after his Zimbabwe livestream went viral. The popular YouTube streamer was visiting the country as part of his Africa tour when viewers noticed a short moment near the end of his stream. During that moment, Miss Universe Zimbabwe 2025 Lyshanda Moyas was seen sitting next to him at a club. Many people online felt that IShowSpeed ignored her, and the clip quickly spread across social media.The livestream took place on January 8, 2026, and ran for a little over five hours. It later crossed three million views. The issue started when users on X pointed out that Lyshanda Moyas appeared briefly but did not interact with the streamer. Some blamed IShowSpeed, while others felt the situation was handled poorly by Moyas‚Äôs team.Lyshanda Moyas appeared around the 5:00:04 timestamp of IShowSpeed‚Äôs stream. The setting was a club or party scene. She was wearing a red jersey and sat beside him for about five minutes. During that time, there was no clear conversation or introduction on camera. Many viewers felt IShowSpeed did not notice who she was.One X user, @freddyMM93, wrote in full:‚ÄúLyshanda our Queen, not everyone knows you. On occasions like these, put on your sash & crown and make it easy for guests to identify you.Speed ‚Äòsnubbed‚Äô you cause he saw you in club & perhaps thought you were one of those. Dont take it to heart, fix that next time.‚ÄùAnother user, @MikelaWacho, shared a similar view and said:‚ÄúYes, iShowSpeed ignored Lyshanda, Miss Universe Zimbabwe, but honestly she could have handled it better. Her brand is massive and should never be left to chance. This is where management matters. Instead, she was positioned like one of those random club chicks waiting for Speed to buy her a drink, which for someone of her calibre was misguided.‚ÄùOthers felt Moyas should have spoken up. @kayzywizzzy said:‚ÄúShe just stood there, what was she expecting? he definitely doesn‚Äôt know her.‚ÄùAnother comment from @Optimus_Dracula added:‚ÄúHe clearly didnt know her and she couldn‚Äôt even introduce herself to his team or him being she was in front of him.‚ÄùLater, entertainment account @richo reported that IShowSpeed only realized who Moyas was after the stream ended. The post also claimed she shared her feelings on Instagram. According to the report, she was upset at first but still thankful for his visit. The post read:‚ÄúiShowSpeed realises after his Zimbabwe stream ends that he accidentally ignored Miss Universe Zimbabwe 2025, who had come out to greet him. She later posted on Instagram saying she was upset at first, but still happy to see him exploring and celebrating her beautiful country.‚ÄùThe same report also showed a clip of IShowSpeed walking past Moyas earlier during a go-karting visit, adding more context to the situation.Also Read: IShowSpeed says ‚Äúnever again‚Äù after weight loss drink sends him running to washroom during South Africa livestream
Article Summary: Youtube streamer ishowspeed was visiting zimbabwe as part of his africa tour. Viewers noticed a short moment near the end of his stream when lyshanda moyas was seen sitting next to him at a club. Many people online felt that ishow speed ignored her, and the clip quickly spread across social media.
